title: [Bug] The "yes" and "No" actions in the "Empty cards" alert dialog appear to be switched with each other
body:
###### Reproduction Steps

1. Tap the three dot icon on the deck picker screen
2. Tap "Empty cards"
   (Then, a progress dialog of "Finding empty cards..." gets shown)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/199731305-11127ab6-4e90-47ec-8f81-7be61dc179ec.png)
4. Tap Back button during the message is shown
   (Then, an alert dialog of "Do you want to cancel?" gets shown)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/200163992-86b282a0-444a-454e-9c7a-7138e98818e6.png)
5. Tap "yes"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/200164047-e1c0aa0f-3727-4d33-9a1d-b056ecf2cba4.png)

###### Expected Result
The action of "Empty cards" (= finding empty cards) gets canceled.
(I interpret the "yes" as "yes, I want to cancel the action of 'Empty cards'")


###### Actual Result
The action of "Empty cards" doesn't get canceled. The progress dialog of "Finding empty cards..." gets shown again. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/199731305-11127ab6-4e90-47ec-8f81-7be61dc179ec.png)

On the contrary, the action of "Empty cards" gets canceled by tapping "No".

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/200164857-858a981f-6a33-41b6-b5a5-cd692052fcd1.mp4

```
        private fun confirmCancel(deckPicker: DeckPicker, task: Cancellable) {
            MaterialDialog(deckPicker).show {
                message(R.string.confirm_cancel)
                positiveButton(R.string.dialog_yes) {
                    actualOnPreExecute(deckPicker)
                }
                negativeButton(R.string.dialog_no) {
                    task.safeCancel()
                }
            }
```
https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/blob/main/AnkiDroid/src/main/java/com/ichi2/anki/DeckPicker.kt#L2532-L2541

I suspect that the actions of "yes" and "No" are unintentionally switched with each other. Isn’t it natural that "yes" leads canceling finding empty cards?

###### Debug info
```
AnkiDroid Version = 2.16alpha89

Android Version = 11

Manufacturer = OPPO

Model = CPH2013

Hardware = qcom

Webview User Agent = Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 11; CPH2013 Build/RKQ1.200903.002; wv) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Chrome/106.0.5249.126 Mobile Safari/537.36

ACRA UUID = 7fa108ed-8b79-4927-9c5a-09dd92f52b04

New schema = true

Scheduler = std3

Crash Reports Enabled = true

DatabaseV2 Enabled = true
```
###### Research

- [x] I have read the [support page](https://ankidroid.org/docs/help.html) and am reporting a bug or enhancement request specific to AnkiDroid
- [x] I have checked the [manual](https://ankidroid.org/docs/manual.html) and the [FAQ](https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/wiki/FAQ) and could not find a solution to my issue
- [x] I have searched for similar existing issues here and on the user forum
- [x] (Optional) I have confirmed the issue is not resolved in the latest alpha release ([instructions](https://docs.ankidroid.org/manual.html#betaTesting))
